page.title: 08AGRICULTURE
page.content: 5 farms surround the village of Little Weighton. Although this gives an impression of being an agricultural community, the 5 farms between them employ only 12 workers, half of whom are employed on a casual basis. All the farms have a lot of expensive machinery and we think that is why not many workers are needed. Little Weighton is on the Southern edge of the Yorkshire Wolds so the land is quite high up and rather chalky. Crops grown include winter wheat, oats, barley, oil seed rape, potatoes, peas, beans and grass. Animals on these farms include sheep,cattle and pigs. The smallest farm is 145 acres and the largest is 600 acres. Machinery used includes tractors, combine harvesters, drills, cultivators and ploughs.
